verses.verse: The praise of an Ode, by David. O COME, let us sing with joy to the Lord; let us shout triumphantly to God our Saviour:
let us approach his presence with a song of praise, and shout with joy to him in psalms,
that the Lord is a great God and a great king over all the Gods; and that the Lord will not cast off his people:
that in his hand are the limits of the earth; and the lofty mountains are his:
that the sea is his; he made it; and his hands formed the dry land.
O come, let us worship and bow down before him, and let us weep before the Lord, our maker.
Because he is our God, and we are the people of his pasture, and the flock of his hand;
To-day, since you have heard his voice, let not your hearts be refractory as at the great provocation—as in the day of the temptation in the desert,
(J) where your father’s tried me; they proved me, though they had seen my works.
Forty years. I was incensed with that generation, and said, They do always err with the heart; and have not known my ways; so in mine indignation,
I solemnly said, They shall not enter into my rest.
